channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Zohran Mamdani will be the next mayor of New York City
item.description: The 34-year-old, Ugandan-born democratic socialist defeated former New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo, who ran as an Independent, in Tuesday's election, according to a race call by the Associated Press.
item.content:encoded: The 34-year-old, Ugandan-born democratic socialist defeated former New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo, who ran as an Independent, in Tuesday's election, according to a race call by the Associated Press.
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Pentagon pilot program trains students to be future federal workers
item.description: Between DOGE and the government shutdown, it's a tough time to be a federal worker. But students in a Pentagon-funded pilot program are excited about working for the government.
item.content:encoded: Between DOGE and the government shutdown, it's a tough time to be a federal worker. But students in a Pentagon-funded pilot program are excited about working for the government.
item.dc:creator: Jay Price

item.title: After 200 years, a first daughter comes home
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with retired teacher Barbara VornDick about her years-long efforts to shed new light on the life and death of Eliza Monroe Hay, President James Monroe's eldest daughter.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with retired teacher Barbara VornDick about her years-long efforts to shed new light on the life and death of Eliza Monroe Hay, President James Monroe's eldest daughter.
item.dc:creator: Linah Mohammad

item.title: With fewer samples from other countries, CDC has dimmer global view of flu and COVID
item.description: There's been a significant slowdown in influenza and COVID samples sent to CDC from other countries, which could impair pandemic preparedness and vaccine development
item.content:encoded: There's been a significant slowdown in influenza and COVID samples sent to CDC from other countries, which could impair pandemic preparedness and vaccine development
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Lambert

item.title: The D.C. man who threw a sandwich at a federal agent goes on trial
item.description: A man who threw a sub sandwich at a federal agent in Washington, D.C., is now on trial for assault. He's come to symbolize resistance to President Trump's federal surge in the city.
item.content:encoded: A man who threw a sub sandwich at a federal agent in Washington, D.C., is now on trial for assault. He's come to symbolize resistance to President Trump's federal surge in the city.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: Part 2: Austrian nuns left a retirement home to break into their old convent
item.description: Three Austrian nuns leave a retirement home to break into their old convent with local support and an Instagram following.
item.content:encoded: Three Austrian nuns leave a retirement home to break into their old convent with local support and an Instagram following.
item.dc:creator: Esme Nicholson

item.title: California voters decide on redistricting
item.description: California voters are deciding whether to redistrict to help Democrats win seats in next year's midterms. It comes as a response to President Trump getting Texas to redraw maps to help Republicans.
item.content:encoded: California voters are deciding whether to redistrict to help Democrats win seats in next year's midterms. It comes as a response to President Trump getting Texas to redraw maps to help Republicans.
item.dc:creator: Guy Marzorati

item.title: Supreme Court to hear arguments about tariff legality
item.description: Ahead of the Supreme Court arguments about President Trump's tariff policy, here's what we know about how tariffs have impacted the U.S. economy.
item.content:encoded: Ahead of the Supreme Court arguments about President Trump's tariff policy, here's what we know about how tariffs have impacted the U.S. economy.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Scientists can't agree on why some autumn leaves go red
item.description: Leaves often turn brilliant colors in autumn. One of those colors has generated a lot of heated debate among scientists in recent years.
item.content:encoded: Leaves often turn brilliant colors in autumn. One of those colors has generated a lot of heated debate among scientists in recent years.
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: Dick Cheney's legacy in Iraq
item.description: Dick Cheney is often described as the chief architect of the Iraq war. In Iraq, he's better remembered as a key figure behind the destruction of the country.
item.content:encoded: Dick Cheney is often described as the chief architect of the Iraq war. In Iraq, he's better remembered as a key figure behind the destruction of the country.
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf
